name: Pandora's Box
shortDescription: The Vessel That Released All Evils Into the World
fullDescription:
The Vessel That Released All Evils Into the World Pandora's Box (originally a pithos or large storage jar) is one of the most famous
                    artifacts in Greek mythology, central to the explanation of why evil exists in the world.
                    According to Hesiod, Zeus created Pandora as a punishment for humanity after Prometheus
                    stole fire from the gods. She was the first mortal woman, crafted by Hephaestus and
                    given gifts by all the gods - hence her name, meaning "all-gifted."
